name: TM16 - Light Screen
effect: Scene - Blessing - Psychic - Status - Blessing – Any user affected by Light Screen may activate it when receiving Special Damage to resist the Damage one step. Light Screen may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

name: TM21 - Frustration
effect: At-Will - Melee, 1 Target - Normal - Physical - DBX, See Effect - AC2 - Frustration's Damage Base is equal to 9 minus the user's Loyalty Value. Using Frustration may make your Pokémon dislike you.

name: Tanga Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Bug-type move. Tier 3.

name: Air Ball
effect: -20 Modifier if the target is Flying or Ice type.

name: Altarianite
effect: Mega Evolves Altaria when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Type Brace (Dark)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Dark Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Helix Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Sweet Confection
effect: The user may trade in this Snack’s Food Buff to gain +4 Evasion until the end of their next turn. If the user prefers Sweet Food, they gain +4 Accuracy as well. If the user dislikes Sweet Food, they become Enraged.

name: Type Booster (Electric)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Electric Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Storage Case
effect: These extremely useful cases are capable of “Capturing” non-living matter. Once applied to a Poké Ball, Storage Cases cannot be removed. The object or objects in question must be smaller than 2 meters in any dimension. A single Storage Case can capture several discrete objects, but they must all be supported by a single surface; a 2x2 meter rug or mat is often used for this purpose. Capture Rolls against inanimate objects automatically succeed. Poké Balls with Storage Cases count towards the total number of Pokémon that the trainer can carry. Storage Cases are often illegal due to their uses in smuggling and theft.

name: Sun Stone
effect: Evolves Gloom, Sunkern, Cottonee, Petilil, Helioptile

name: Type Brace (Dragon)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Dragon Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Leppa Berry
effect: Restores a Scene Move. Tier 3.

name: Luxury Ball
effect: A caught Pokémon is easily pleased and starts with a raised happiness. -5 modifier.

name: Shell Bell
effect: Whenever the user damages a foe, they gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Cleanse Tag
effect:
Small strips of paper with a prayer/incantation written on them. When created, the creator makes an Occult Ed Roll; this is the Cleanse Tag’s Power Value. When glued, taped, or nailed to a surface, they stop Pokémon or Trainers within 30m of the tag from Phasing through that surface unless they make a Focus check with a result exceeding the Tag’s Power Value. On a success, the tag is destroyed; on failure, the tag holds, and the encroacher cannot try again for at least an hour.

Tags may be stuck onto a weapon or appendage to let a Normal or Fighting-Type Attack hit a Ghost-Type Pokémon for neutral Damage; Tag is destroyed once damage is dealt.

Novice Occult Ed: Can burn tag as a Standard Action to remove Cursed, Suppressed, or Disabled condition from a single target within 5m.
Expert Occult Ed: Can burn tag to cause all with Invisibility and Phasing capabilities to make a Focus check; if result does not exceed tag's power value, capabilities lost for 5 min

name: TM52 - Focus Blast
effect: Scene x2 - 6, 1 Target, Smite, Aura - Fighting - Special - DB12 - AC7 - Focus Blast lowers the target's Special Defense by -1 Combat Stage on 18+.

name: Pink Apricorn
effect: Used to make Love Balls.

name: TM10 - Hidden Power
effect: EOT - Burst 1 - Normal - Special - DB6 - AC2 - When a Pokémon first obtains the Move Hidden Power, roll 1d20. Hidden Power’s Elemental Type will be changed from Normal to Bug on a result of 1; Dark on 2; Dragon on 3; Electric on 4; Fairy on 5; Fighting on 6; Fire on 7; Flying on 8; Ghost on 9; Grass on 10; Ground on 11; Ice on 12; Normal on 13; Poison on 14; Psychic on 15; Rock on 16; Steel on 17; Water on 18; and on 19 or 20, reroll until you roll another number. This effect is permanent – if Hidden Power is forgotten and relearned, the chosen Type remains the same.

name: Salty Surprise
effect: The user may trade in this Snack’s Food Buff when being hit by an attack to gain 5 Temporary Hit Points. If the user likes Salty Flavors, they gain 10 Temporary Hit Points Instead. If the user dislikes Salty Food, they become Enraged.

name: Super Repel
effect: Lasts 2 hours; causes Pokémon of level 25 or lower to flee.\n\nSpraying a wild Pokémon directly with Repel will cause that Pokémon, if the Repel can affect Pokémon of that level, to immediately shift away from the user as far as the Pokémon is able as an Interrupt, forfeiting their next Shift Action. Spraying a Pokémon with a Repel is an AC6 Status Attack.

name: Poffin Mixer
effect: A Poffin Mixer can be used by any Trainer to create Poffins. You simply insert cooking ingredients worth $500, and at least one of the listed berries. You create two Poffins that raises the Contest Stat most represented by the berries used by +1 Contest Die. Some Berries can raise multiple Contest Stats; you choose which to raise when using these Berries to make Poffins. Poffins can be purchased for $500 in bakeries.\n\nCheri, Figy, Razz, Spelon and Belue Berries raise Cool; Chesto, Wiki, Bluk, Spelon and Pamtre Berries raise Beauty; Pecha, Mago, Nanab, Pamtre, and Watmel Berries raise Cute; Rawst, Aguav, Wepear, Watmel, and Durin Berries raise Smart; Aspear, Iapapa, Pinap, Durin, and Belue Berries raise Tough.

name: Dowsing Rod
effect: Dowsing Rods have been attuned to the energy resonance given off by Shards and may be used while in any route, cave, or outside area. They may be activated by spending 10 minutes searching an area, and may be activated a number of times per day equal to half of the trainer’s Occult Education Rank.\n\nRoll 1d6 per Occult Ed Rank. If the area being searched is a beach, cave, desert, or any other sandy/rocky area, roll +1d6. If you have Skill Stunt (Dowsing), roll an additional 1d6. For each die that results in 4 or higher, you find 1 Shard of a random color: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, or Violet. You may reroll any die that result in 6, gaining that shard and potentially more.

name: Medichamite
effect: Mega Evolves Medicham when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Rad Fashion
effect: Fashionista Skill: Command\nThe holder may activate this item once a Scene as a Free Action to gain a +4 bonus to a single Save Check.

name: Choice Item (Attack)
effect: The default state of the holder's Attack Stat is +2 Combat Stages. However, the holder is Suppressed and cannot be cured until the end of Combat, even if the item is removed. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Thermal Goggles
effect: Allows you to see in the IR spectrum, enabling you to easily pick out a person or Pokémon in camouflage or to identify sources of heat. Head equipment slot.

name: TM42 - Facade
effect: EOT - Melee, 1 Target - Normal - Physical - DB7 - AC2 - If the user is afflicted with a Persistent Status Affliction, Facade's Damage Base is doubled to DB 14 (4d10+15 / 40).

name: Bluk Berry
effect: Beauty Poffin Ingredient. Tier 1.

name: Type Plate (Water)
effect: Acts as both a Type Booster (Water) and a Type Brace (Water). Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Hearty Meal
effect: When consumed, that Trainer gains +2 to their Max AP until the end of their next extended rest. A Trainer may only be under the effect of one Hearty Meal at a time. Hearty Meals not consumed within 20 minutes of being created lose all flavor and all effect.

name: Sport Ball
effect: Used during Safari hunts.

name: Reaper Cloth
effect: Evolves Dusclops.

name: White Light
effect: So named for the soft white glow the liquid gives off, White Light is a crude “truth serum”. It is slow-acting, taking upwards of an hour to take full effect on a victim. The victim becomes more suggestible and gullible. All of their Guile, Intuition, and Focus Checks made during an interrogation are subject to a -5 penalty.

name: Rowap Berry
effect: The foe dealing Special Damage to the user loses 1/8 of their Maximum HP. Tier 2.

name: Iron Ball
effect: The Holder’s Speed is halved, and any immunity to Ground Type is lost. Hand Item for Trainers. Standard Action to drop.

name: Type Brace (Ground)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Ground Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Dome Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Grepa Berry
effect: Lowers Special Defense Base Stat by 1 when consumed, only if Pokémon’s trainer wishes it to. Tier 3.

name: Manectite
effect: Mega Evolves Manectric when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Cover Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Contest Case
effect: Whenever a Pokémon is released from a Contest Case into a Contest, they gain 1 Appeal Point during the introduction stage.

name: Banettite
effect: Mega Evolves Banette when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Cover Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Sharpedonite
effect: Mega Evolves Sharpedo when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Thick Club
effect: When held by a Cubone or Marowak, this rare, dense bone grants the Pure Power Ability. Thick Clubs are Wielded. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Rabuta Berry
effect: Cures Suppressed condition. Tier 2.

name: Sail Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Type Plate (Flying)
effect: Acts as both a Type Booster (Flying) and a Type Brace (Flying). Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: The Joy of Cooking
effect:
A cookbook for novice and experienced chefs alike.

Rank 1 - Novice General Education: Your material costs for crafting Food Items of any variety are reduced by 10%.
Rank 2 - Expert General Education: Meal and Refreshment Items you create cause whoever eats them to gain a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Pokémon Daycare Licensing Guide
effect:
This book teaches advanced Pokémon Breeding techniques.

Rank 1 - Adept Pokémon Education: When Breeding Pokémon of this Book’s Egg Group, you may choose which parent’s species the Egg is of.
Rank 2 - Master Pokémon Education: When hatching Eggs of Pokémon of this Book’s Egg Group, the hatched Pokémon learns their first Inheritance Move at Level 10 instead of Level 20.

name: Spray Case
effect: A Spray Case may be filled with a Pester Ball or Repel of any variety. This consumes the used item. Upon hitting a target, the Spray Case is emptied, spraying the item it was filled with onto its target, automatically hitting. This can occur when attempting to catch Pokémon (the effect is resolved before the capture roll), or when releasing a Pokémon from its Poké Ball (the effect is resolved before the Pokémon within is released). Spray Cases may be refilled numerous times, but may only have one sort of consumable in them at a time.

name: Skull Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Adorable Fashion
effect: Fashionista Skill: Charm\nThe holder may activate this item once a Scene as a Free Action to gain +2 Evasion for one full round.

name: Groomer's Kit
effect: Used by Trainers with the Groomer Edge to clean their Pokémon.

name: Dino Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: TM84 - Poison Jab
effect: EOT - Melee, 1 Target - Poison - Physical - DB8 - AC2 - Poison Jab Poisons the target on 15+.

name: Zygarde Cube
effect: Using a Zygarde Cube, as an Extended Action, 10 Cells may be formed into a 10% Zygarde, and 50 Cells may be formed into a 50% Zygarde. These may be disassembled into the number of Cells that they were created from as an Extended Action. 100 Cells may form either a 10% or 50% Zygarde with the Power Construct Ability as a Bonus Ability. The resulting Zygarde may not be disassembled, but may be changed between 10% and 50% Formes as an Extended Action using the Cube. The GM determines the Nature and Level of any Zygarde formed. As an Extended Action, a Cube may Tutor Zygarde available Cube moves for 1 TP each.

name: Revival Herb
effect: Revives Pokémon and sets to 50% Hit Points - Herbal Restorative.

name: Red Apricorn
effect: Used to make Level Balls.

name: Aggronite
effect: Mega Evolves Aggron when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Collection Jar
effect: A simple sealable glass jar. Useful when collecting Items from Pokémon, such as Honey from Pokémon with the Honey Gather Ability, or MooMoo Milk from Pokémon with the Milk Collection Ability. Available almost everywhere.

name: TM38 - Fire Blast
effect: Scene x2 - 6, 1 Target, Smite - Fire - Special - DB11 - AC4 - Fire Blast burns the target on 19+.

name: Type Brace (Psychic)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Psychic Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Super Potion
effect: Heals 35 Hit Points

name: Flippers
effect: Flippers grant a +2 bonus to your Swim speed when fully submerged, and decrease your Overland speed by the same amount.

name: Super Soda Pop
effect: Heals 30 Hit Points. A Pokémon or Trainer can only consume one refreshment per half hour, unless they have the Gluttony Ability.

name: Type Brace (Fire)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Fire Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Fancy Clothes
effect: Each set of Fancy Clothes is assigned a Contest Stat – either Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough. Trainers wearing these clothes may roll 2d6 during the Introduction Stage of a Contest to try to generate Contest Stat Dice for the assigned Stat.

name: TM36 - Sludge Bomb
effect: EOT - 8, 1 Target - Poison - Special - DB9 - AC2 - Sludge Bomb Poisons the target on 15+.

name: Pokédex
effect: A hand-held computer with an advanced camera and image recognition software given to trainers at the start of their journey.  A trainer can use a Standard Action to identify a Pokémon within 10m using the Pokédex's scanner.  Doing so reveals the average height/weight of the species, height/weight of the target, moves that the Species learns through Level Up, and some brief facts about the species' behavior.\n\nPokédexes may also function as smartphones, and in most circumstances they should be made available for free to starting characters.

name: DIY Engineering
effect:
For those who like the homemade touch, and aren't afraid to learn by doing.

Rank 1 - Novice Technology Education: Your material costs for crafting items crafted from Mechanical Scrap are reduced by 10%.
Rank 2 - Expert Technology Education: Whenever you Scrap an Item you created, you gain Scrap worth 75% of its monetary cost instead of only 50%.

name: TM11 - Sunny Day
effect: Daily x2 - Field, Weather - Fire - Status - The weather becomes Sunny for 5 rounds. While Sunny, Fire-Type Attacks gain a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls, and Water-Type Attacks suffer a -5 Damage penalty.

name: Anti-Radiation Pills
effect: An advanced version of the real life potassium iodide pills. These not only protect the thyroid but instead guard against all forms of radiation poisoning, granting the user Hazard Immunity for radioactive environments only for 24 hours.

name: Leftovers
effect: Snack. When their Food Buff is traded in, the user recovers 1/16th of their max Hit Points at the beginning of each turn for the rest of the encounter.

name: Armor Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Treecko Gear
effect: Grants the Wallclimber capability. Main Hand, Off Hand and Feet equipment slots.

name: Winter Cloak
effect: The user does not take damage from Hail. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Razor Fang
effect: The holder’s damaging attacks cause an Injury on a roll of 19+. Accessory Item for Trainers. Evolves Gligar.

name: Claw Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Venusaurite
effect: Mega Evolves Venusaur when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Type Booster
effect: Type Boosters come in a variety of each of the Elemental Types, and grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct damage Moves of its Specific Type when performed by the user. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Antidote
effect: Cures Poison.

name: Blazikenite
effect: Mega Evolves Blaziken when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: TM04 - Calm Mind
effect: EOT - Self - Psychic - Status - Raise the user’s Special Attack 1 Combat Stage and raise the user’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage.

name: Mega Ring
effect: Mega Rings are extraordinarily rare accessories that allow a Trainer’s Pokémon to Mega Evolve when used in conjunction with a Mega Stone. They cannot be bought in stores anywhere and must usually be earned through a trial of sorts, governed by a Gym Leader or other influential Pokémon Trainer. They can take the form of a bracelet, a necklace, or an actual ring.

name: Oval Stone
effect: Evolves Happiny.

name: Big Mushroom
effect: The user becomes Poisoned; if they do, they gain +1 Combat Stage in two random Stats.

name: Dome Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Protein
effect: Raise the user’s Attack Base Stat 1. You may only get use out of up to five Vitamins per Pokémon.

name: TM43 - Flame Charge
effect: At-Will - Melee, 1 Target, Dash - Fire - Physical - DB5 - AC2 - Raise the user’s Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Safari Ball
effect: Used during Safari hunts.

name: Heavy Ball
effect: -5 Modifier for each Weight Class the target is above 1.

name: Type Booster (Fire)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Fire Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: TM14 - Blizzard
effect: Scene x2 - 4, Ranged Blast 2, Smite - Ice - Special - DB11 - AC7 - Blizzard Freezes all legal target on 15+. If the target is in Hailing Weather, Blizzard cannot miss.

name: Bounce Case
effect: A Poké Ball in a Bounce Case may bounce once when thrown or launched, up to a distance of 3 meters. This can be used to extend the effective range of a Poké Ball, hit around obstacles, or trigger effects such as the Capture Specialist’s Curve Ball on an additional target.

name: Pester Ball (Rage)
effect: Inflicts Rage on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Poké Balls.

name: TM44 - Rest
effect: Scene - Self, Healing - Psychic - Status - The user is set to their full Hit Point value. The user is cured of any Status ailments. Then, the user falls Asleep. The user cannot make Sleep Checks at the beginning of their turn. They are cured of the Sleep at the end of their turn in 2 rounds.

name: Type Booster (Fairy)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Fairy Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Good Rod
effect: A better fishing rod. May catch unevolved Pokémon of a Level to your GM's discretion.

name: Dark Vision Goggles
effect: These Goggles simply grant the Darkvision Capability while worn.

name: Wonder Launcher
effect: This strange and complicated two-handed machine can only be used by those that have an Expert-Level Medicine or Technology Education Skill. The wielder can spend 1 AP to activate it, and apply an X-Item at a Pokémon within 8 meters. X Items applied through the Wonder Launcher do not cause the target to forfeit any actions. Items combined by a Researcher may be used in the Wonder Launcher, and do not cause the target to forfeit any actions even if they are also a Restorative.

name: Shock Syringe
effect: This drug enhances the sensitivity of the user’s nerves, enhancing their perception and making it incredibly useful for scouts and recon missions. However, the enhanced sense of touch greatly lowers the user’s pain tolerance. The user gains a +3 bonus to Perception, Focus, and Guile and a +1 bonus to Accuracy. However, each time the user takes an Injury, they are Flinched. The effects of Shock Syringe last for an hour.

name: Haban Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Dragon-type move. Tier 3.

name: Pidgeotite
effect: Mega Evolves Pidgeotto when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Spelon Berry
effect: Cool or Beauty Poffin Ingredient. Tier 2.

name: Type Plate (Fighting)
effect: Acts as both a Type Booster (Fighting) and a Type Brace (Fighting). Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: TM89 - U-Turn
effect: At-Will - Melee, 1 Target, Dash - Bug - Physical - DB7 - AC2 - The user deals damage and then is immediately recalled to its Poké Ball in the same turn. A New Pokémon may immediately be sent out. Using U-Turn lets a Trapped user be recalled.

name: TM09 - Venoshock
effect: Scene x2 - 6, 1 Target - Poison - Special - DB7 - AC2 - If the target is Poisoned, Venoshock has a Damage Base of 13 (4d10+10 / 35) instead.

name: Super Bait
effect:
Super Bait is a tasty, strong-smelling morsel of food designed to attract Pokémon. It may be used in two ways; to lure Pokémon, or to distract Pokémon.

To lure Pokémon, set the super bait on a route. Every 15 minutes thereafter, roll 1d20+Intuition Rank until you roll 15 or higher. If you roll 3 times without success, the super bait loses its potency and fails. If you succeed however, a random Pokémon will appear. Super bait is often used for Fishing in this way.
To distract Pokémon, throw it at a Wild Pokémon as a Standard Action. The target must then make a Focus Roll with a DC of 12. If they fail, the Pokémon gives up its next Standard Action to eat the food.

name: Type Gem (Steel)
effect: Can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 DB bonus to one Steel-Type attack. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Lighter
effect: For creating flames in a hurry.

name: TM81 - X-Scissor
effect: At-Will - Melee, 1 Target, Dash - Bug - Physical - DB8 - AC2

name: TM93 - Wild Charge
effect: At-Will - Melee, 1 Target, Dash, Recoil 1/4 - Electric - Physical - DB9 - AC2

name: Smart Poffin
effect: Raises Smart Contest Stat by +1 Contest Die.  Made with Rawst, Aguav, Wepear, Watmel, and Durin Berries.

name: Rough Fashion
effect: Fashionista Skill: Intimidate\nThe holder may activate this item once a Scene as a Free Action to cause a foe within 5 meters to take a -2 penalty to all rolls for one full round.

name: TM83 - Infestation
effect: Scene x2 - 3, 1 Target - Bug - Special - DB4 - AC4 - The target is put in a Vortex.

name: Thermal Dampening Suit
effect: The user is invisible to thermal imaging gear. Body equipment slot.

name: Stat Suppressant (Special Defense)
effect: Lowers Special Defense stat by 1 if Trainer allows it.

name: Type Booster (Steel)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Steel Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Mago Berry
effect: Sweet Treat. Heals 1/8th of the Pokémon’s Max HP. If the user likes the Treat’s flavor, it heals 1/6th instead. If the user dislikes the treat’s flavor, the user is Confused. Cute Poffin Ingredient. Tier 2.

name: Type Booster (Poison)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Poison Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Type Gem (Electric)
effect: Can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 Damage Base bonus to one Electric-Type attack. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Zinc
effect: Raise the user’s Special Defense Base Stat 1. You may only get use out of up to five Vitamins per Pokémon.

name: Vile Bait
effect:
Vile Bait is a strong-smelling morsel of food designed to attract Pokémon. Pokémon that eat it are poisoned.

To lure Pokémon, set the vile bait on a route. Every 15 minutes thereafter, roll 1d20 until you roll 15 or higher. If you roll 3 times without success, the vile bait loses its potency and fails. If you succeed however, a random Pokémon will appear. Vile bait is often used for Fishing in this way.
To distract Pokémon, throw it at a Wild Pokémon as a Standard Action. The target must then make a Focus Roll with a DC of 12. If they fail, the Pokémon gives up its next Standard Action to eat the food.

name: Sablenite
effect: Mega Evolves Sableye when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Type Gem (Psychic)
effect: Can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 DB bonus to one Psychic-Type attack. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Rare Leek
effect: When held by a Farfetch’d, this rare Leek increase the holder’s critical range by 2. Rare Leeks are Wielded. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Rawst Berry
effect: Cures Burn, Smart Poffin Ingredient. Tier 1.

name: Ultra Ball
effect: The best generic Poké Ball. -15  Modifier.

name: Balm Mushroom
effect: The user is cured of Burn, Paralysis, or Poison. If they are, they lose 1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.

name: Contest Fashion
effect: These Items have a chosen Contest Stat; Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough. When held, once per Contest, the holder may re-roll any 1s made when using a Move of the chosen Type. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Max Repel
effect: Lasts 5 hours; causes Pokémon of level 35 or lower to flee.\n\nSpraying a wild Pokémon directly with Repel will cause that Pokémon, if the Repel can affect Pokémon of that level, to immediately shift away from the user as far as the Pokémon is able as an Interrupt, forfeiting their next Shift Action. Spraying a Pokémon with a Repel is an AC6 Status Attack.

name: Poké Ball Tracking Chip
effect: A chip embedded in the inner workings of the Poké Ball that emits a signal allowing the Ball’s owner to remotely track the location of the Ball. Depending on the setting, these may be built in by default.

name: Locus Lozenge
effect: A drug to help the user focus on a single task. The user gains a +3 bonus to Focus and Intuition checks for the next hour but suffers a -4 penalty to Perception checks to notice outside events.

name: Rare Candy
effect: These very rare treats are created from Shuckles that have held a Berry for a long time. When ingested by a Pokémon, the eater gains enough experience to reach its next Level. Pokémon may benefit from up to five Rare Candies in their lifetime.

name: Bitter Treat
effect: The user may trade in this Snack’s Food Buff when being hit by a Special Attack to increase their Damage Reduction by +5 against that attack. If the user prefers Bitter Food, they gain +10 Damage Reduction instead. If the user dislikes Bitter Food, they become Enraged.

name: Lifting Frame
effect: A mechanized frame worn over each arm with motorized muscles. Grants +2 to Power Capability. The frames are too unwieldy to use other equipment such as weapons while wearing them. Main and Off Hand equipment slots.

name: Mega Stone
effect: An item that allows a Pokémon to Mega Evolve when used in conjunction with a Mega Ring. Each Mega Stone is specific to one species and Mega Evolved form.

name: Type Brace (Water)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Water Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: TM96 - Nature Power
effect: EOT - See Effect - Normal - Status - DBSee Effect - ACSee Effect - Nature Power uses a Move defined by the Environ keyword.

name: TM100 - Confide
effect: At-Will - 4, 1 Target, Social - Normal - Status - AC2 - Lower the target's Special Attack by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Bait Attachment
effect: These attachments afix a piece of bait to the triggering device of a Poké Ball. When the bait is taken, the attachment automatically triggers a capture attempt along with any effect that would be caused by a Poké Ball Cases.

name: Mewtwonite Y
effect: Mega Evolves Mewtwo when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Soldier Pill
effect: A potentially dangerous stimulant that provides the user enough energy to go 24 hours without sleep. Upon taking the pill twice in a 48 hour period, the user begins to take 1 injury every 2 hours until they choose to go to sleep. The user of a Soldier Pill gets a +3 bonus to rolls to wake up from Sleep.

name: Type Booster (Ice)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Ice Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Pamtre Berry
effect: Cute or Beauty Poffin Ingredient. Tier 2.

name: Type Booster (Rock)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Rock Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Type Booster (Ground)
effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Ground Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Latiosite
effect: Mega Evolves Latios when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Kee Berry
effect: +1 Defense Combat Stage. Activates as a Free Action when hit by a Physical Move. Tier 3.

name: Lagging Item (Defense)
effect: The holder's Defense Stat is set to -4 Combat Stages. Cannot be used by Trainers. Standard Action to drop.

name: Dream Mist
effect: Dream Mist may be used as an AC 6 Melee Status Attack, performed as a Standard Action. If it hits, the target falls Asleep. Dream Mist is collected from Pokémon with the eponymous Capability using a Collection Jar.

name: Fishing Lure
effect: Instead of Bait, some trainers may opt to use a Fishing Lure when attempting to Fish. Fishing Lures work just like Bait, but can be used multiple times. If the line snaps or the fish gets away, they may take your lure with them, however.

name: Prescient Powder
effect: An illegal and dangerous substance produced by desert-dwelling Steelix. Taking the drug inflicts 3 injuries on the user and allows them to use either a Scry or Augury once. The user also gains the Psychic Navigator Edge for two hours. Habitual use of the drug can lead to addiction and health problems.

name: Focus Sash
effect: Once a Scene, if damage from a Move would take Focus Sash’s holder’s Hit Points from Max to 0 or less, Focus Sash’s holder instead has 1 Hit Point remaining. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Blue Shard
effect: Associated with Water, Ice, & Flying. With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Water Stone.

name: X Special
effect: Increases the Pokémon’s Special Attack by two Combat Stages.

name: TM65 - Shadow Claw
effect: EOT - Melee, Pass - Ghost - Physical - DB7 - AC2 - Shadow Claw is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Tiny Mushroom
effect: The user loses 5 HP, and gains +1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.

name: Reanimation Machine
effect: Can be used to revive Fossils. Reanimation Machines also come in a smaller but more expensive Portable variety. Prices are up to GM discretion, often upwards of $10,000.

name: EMP Grenade
effect: Throwing an EMP Grenade is an AC 5 Ranged Blast 3 attack that can be made at a target within your Poké Ball throwing range. All legal targets with Augmentations immediately suffer the effects of Augmentation Shock. EMP Grenades flinch targets with Augmentations on a roll of 18+ on Accuracy Check. EMP Grenades disable Pokébots for 1d2 turns.

name: Up-Grade
effect: Evolves Porygon.

name: Pester Ball (Sleep)
effect: Causes the target to fall asleep. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Poké Balls.

name: Type Brace (Poison)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Poison Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Type Gem (Dragon)
effect: Can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 Damage Base bonus to one Dragon-Type attack. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: MooMoo Milk
effect: Heals 80 Hit Points. A Pokémon or Trainer can only consume one refreshment per half hour, unless they have the Gluttony Ability.

name: Bean Cap
effect:
AC: (6 minus Tech Edu Rank, Min 2)
Range: 10 meters
Effect: The target takes 20 Physical, Normal-Type Damage. On 18+, the target is Tripped and loses a Tick of Hit Points.
Bean Caps shoot as a small cloth projectile filed with beads, which explodes upon contact.

name: First Aid Kit
effect: Required to use the First Aid Expertise Feature. By Draining 1 AP, any Trainer can make a Medicine Education Check on a target as an Extended Action. The target gains Hit Points equal to the result, and is cured of Burn, Poison, and Paralysis.

name: Earth Ball
effect: -20 Modifier if the target is Grass or Ground type.

name: Flame Retardant Armor
effect: You gain 10 Damage Reduction against Fire Type damage.

name: Bird Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Sleeping Bag
effect: A standard sleeping bag. Holds one person.

name: TM92 - Trick Room
effect: Daily x2 - Field - Psychic - Status - Starting at the beginning of the next round, for 5 rounds, the area is considered Rewinding. While Rewinding, Initiative is reversed, and participants instead go from lowest Initiative to highest.

name: TM35 - Flamethrower
effect: EOT - 4, 1 Target - Fire - Special - DB9 - AC2 - Flamethrower Burns the target on 19+.

name: Repeat Ball
effect: -20 Modifier if you already own a Pokémon of the target’s species.

name: Power Herb
effect: Eliminates the Set-Up turn of Moves with the Set-Up Keyword.

name: Type Plate (Steel)
effect: Acts as both a Type Booster (Steel) and a Type Brace (Steel). Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Babiri Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Steel-type move. Tier 3.

name: Alakazite
effect: Mega Evolves Alakazam when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Dragon Scale
effect: Evolves Seadra.

name: Glue Cap
effect: AC: (8 minus Tech Edu Rank, Min 2)\nRange: 8 meters\nEffect: Cause the target to become Slowed, and their Initiative is lowered by 5. On 18+, the target is also Stuck and Trapped.

name: Fish Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Houndoominite
effect: Mega Evolves Houndoom when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Ice Heal
effect: Cures Freezing

name: X Accuracy
effect: Increases Accuracy by +2.

name: TM47 - Low Sweep
effect: EOT - Melee, 1 Target - Fighting - Physical - DB7 - AC2 - Lower the target’s Speed by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Rindo Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Grass-type move. Tier 3.

name: Hondew Berry
effect: Lowers Special Attack Base Stat by 1 when consumed, only if Pokémon’s trainer wishes it to. Tier 3.

name: Pester Ball (Paralysis)
effect: Inflicts Paralysis on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Poké Balls.

name: Stat Suppressant (Attack)
effect: Lowers the user's Attack Base Stat by 1. Only functions if the Trainer wants it to.

name: TM05 - Roar
effect: Scene - Burst 1, Sonic, Social - Normal - Status - AC2 - When declaring Roar, the user does nothing. At the end of the round, the user Shifts and uses Roar. Targets hit by Roar immediately Shift away from the user using their highest useable movement capability, towards their Trainer if possible. If the target is an owned Pokémon and ends this shift within 6 meters of their Poké Ball, they are immediately recalled to their Poké Ball. If that Trainer sends out a replacement, they do not lose their Command action.

name: Black Apricorn
effect: Used to make Heavy Balls.

name: Safety Goggles
effect: The holder is immune to Moves with the Powder Keyword. Accessory or Head Item for Trainers.

name: Gas Mask
effect: Gas Masks are invaluable equipment when trying to breathe in toxic environments or heavy smoke. They not only let you breathe through environmental toxins or smoke, but you become immune to the Moves Rage Powder, Poison Gas, Poisonpowder, Sleep Powder, Smog, Smokescreen, Spore, Stun Spore, and Sweet Scent.

name: Roseli Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Fairy-type move. Tier 3.

name: Poultices
effect: Poultices are applied as Extended Actions on Pokémon or Trainers. Poultices last for 6 hours; while applied, they double the Natural Healing Rate of Pokémon or Trainers, meaning a Pokémon or Trainer will heal 1/8th of their Hit Points per half hour. Poultices also immediately heal one Injury if they remain in place for their full duration.\n\nIf a Pokémon is damaged or loses Hit Points in any way, the Poulticess immediately stop working.  Poultices are itchy and irritating to the skin and may cause loyalty loss.

name: Abomasite
effect: Mega Evolves Abomasnow when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Lagging Item (Attack)
effect: The holder's Attack Stat is set to -4 Combat Stages. Cannot be used by Trainers. Standard Action to drop.

name: Full Incense
effect: The holder gains the Stall ability. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Super Rod
effect: The best fishing rod. May catch Pokémon of any size and evolutionary stage, to your GM's discretion.

name: Tent
effect: Standard outdoor tents. Provide protection from the elements of nature. A small one person tent would be about 1m x 1.5m x 1.5m, or 2.25 cubic meters – meaning 900 in price.

name: TM91 - Flash Cannon
effect: EOT - 6, 1 Target - Steel - Special - DB8 - AC2 - Flash Cannon lowers the target's Special Defense by -1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Fabulous Ball
effect: The captured Pokémon gains +2 dice in the Contest Stat that corresponds to the Stat boosted by their Nature. If the Stat boosted is HP, choose any two Contest Stats except the one corresponding to the lowered Stat and raise them by 1 die each. As a reminder, Beauty = Special Attack, Cool = Attack, Cute = Speed, Smart = Special Defense, and Tough = Defense.

name: Old Amber Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Anomaly Detector
effect: When pointed at a person, Pokémon, or object, this handheld device can determine whether or not it belongs to this timeline or parallel universe. It gives no indication to the nature of the home universe, however.

name: Armor Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: TM33 - Reflect
effect: Scene - Blessing - Psychic - Status - Blessing – Any user affected by Reflect may activate it when receiving Physical Damage to resist the Damage one step. Reflect may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

name: Revive
effect: Revives fainted Pokémon and sets to 20 Hit Points.

name: Shuca Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Ground-type move. Tier 3.

name: Contest Fashion (Beauty)
effect: Once per Contest the holder may re-roll any 1's made when using a Beauty Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: TM07 - Hail
effect: Daily x2 - Field, Weather - Ice - Status - The weather changes to Hail for 5 rounds. While it is Hailing, all non-Ice Type Pokemon lose a Tick of Hit Points at the beginning of their turn.

name: Net Ball
effect: -20 Modifier if the target is Water or Bug type.

name: HP Up
effect: Raise the user’s HP Base Stat 1. You may only get use out of up to five Vitamins per Pokémon.

name: Type Gem (Ground)
effect: Can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 DB bonus to one Ground-Type attack. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Coba Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Flying-type move. Tier 3.

name: Orange Shard
effect: Associated with Normal, Fighting, & Dragon.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Shiny Stone.

name: Contest Fashion (Cute)
effect: Once per Contest the holder may re-roll any 1's made when using a Cute Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Expert Belt
effect: Whenever the holder deals Super Effective Damage, they deal an additional 5 damage (this damage is not multiplied). Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Tinfoil Gospel: Your Primer on Thwarting the Conspiracies of the New World Order
effect:
An even more questionable tome, filled with laughable conspiracy theories. Its mental exercises are strangely effective, however.

Rank 1 - Novice Occult Education: You gain the Iron Mind Edge and the Skill Stunt - Focus (resisting Telepathy).
Rank 2 - Expert Occult Education: Your Aura becomes muddled and difficult to read. Pokémon and Trainers with the Aura Reader Capability cannot discern the tint of your Aura and must succeed on an opposed Intuition or Focus Check vs your Occult Education or Focus in order to read the hue of your Aura. Upon failure, they may not attempt to read your Aura again for the remainder of the Scene.

name: TM97 - Dark Pulse
effect: EOT - 8, 1 Target, Aura - Dark - Special - DB8 - AC2 - Dark Pulse Flinches the target on 17+.

name: Kasib Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Ghost-type move. Tier 3.

name: Type Brace
effect: These items come in a variety of each of the Elemental Types, and grant the holder 15 Damage Reduction against that specific Type. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Chople Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Fighting-type move. Tier 3.

name: TM48 - Round
effect: EOT - Burst 1, Sonic - Normal - Special - DBX, See Effect - AC2 - Round's Damage Base is equal to 6, plus +2 more for each use of Round by any Trainer or Pokémon this round, up to a maximum of DB 12 (3d12+10 / 30).

name: TM94 - Surf
effect: EOT - Line 6 - Water - Special - DB9 - AC2 - As a Shift Action, the user may Move to any open square in Surf ’s area of effect without provoking any Attacks of Opportunity.

effect: Increases Critical Hit Range of all moves by +2.

name: Plume Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Nomel Berry
effect: Cures Infatuated condition. Tier 2.

name: Friend Ball
effect: A caught Pokémon will start with +1 Loyalty. -5 Modifier.

name: Starf Berry
effect: +2 Combat Stage to a random Stat. May be used only at 25% HP or lower. Tier 2.

name: Bird Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Shield
effect: A Shield is an Off-Hand defensive item held in one hand or braced to an arm. Shields grant +1 Evasion. They may be readied as a Standard Action to instead grant +4 Evasion and 10 Damage Reduction until the end of your next turn, but also cause you to become Slowed for that duration. If used Two-Handed, shields can also function as a Small Melee Weapon.

name: Pinsirite
effect: Mega Evolves Pinsir when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Belue Berry
effect: Cool or Tough Poffin Ingredient. Tier 2.

name: Chilan Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's Normal-type move. Tier 3.

effect: Scene x2 - Burst 1 or Close Blast 2 - Poison - Special - DB10 - AC2 - Sludge Wave Poisons all legal targets on 19+.

effect: Smart or Tough Poffin Ingredient. Tier 2.

effect: Lowers Speed stat by 1 if Trainer allows it.

effect: Heals 70 Hit Points - Herbal Restorative.

name: TM41 - Torment
effect: Scene x2 - 10, 1 Target, Social - Dark - Status - AC2 - The target becomes Suppressed.

name: Universal Translator
effect: You understand any spoken language recognized by the Universal Translator and can speak into it and have your words translated immediately. Usually programmed with all of the major human languages. Can be used to speak with Pokémon. Head equipment slot.

name: Type Plate (Rock)
effect: Acts as both a Type Booster (Rock) and a Type Brace (Rock). Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: X Sp. Def.
effect: Increases the Pokémon’s Special Defense by two Combat Stages.

name: Dusk Ball
effect: -20 Modifier if it is dark, or if there is very little light out, when used.

name: Iron
effect: Raise the user’s Defense Base Stat 1. You may only get use out of up to five Vitamins per Pokémon.

name: Dimensional Field Analyzer
effect: A handheld device the size of a Geiger counter for campaigns featuring time travel or interdimensional travel of some other sort. This device can be calibrated to recognize a ‘home’ universe or timeline and can measure the amount of difference between a parallel universe and that home universe.

name: Oran Berry
effect: Restores 5 Hit Points. Tier 1.

name: TM79 - Frost Breath
effect: EOT - 4, 1 Target - Ice - Special - DB6 - AC3 - If Frost Breath hits, it is a Critical Hit. *Grants: Freezer

name: TM86 - Grass Knot
effect: EOT - 5, 1 Target, Weight Class - Grass - Special - DBX, See Effect - AC2 - Grass Knot's Damage Base is equal to twice the target's Weight Class.

name: Claw Fossil Shard
effect: A fossil shard of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Type Gem (Fighting)
effect: Can be consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 Damage Base bonus to one Fighting-Type attack. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Snow Boots
effect: Snow Boots grant you the Naturewalk (Tundra) capability, but lower your Overland Speed by -1 while on ice or deep snow.

name: Jaboca Berry
effect: The foe dealing Physical Damage to the user loses 1/8 of their Maximum HP. Tier 2.

name: TM82 - Dragon Tail
effect: At-Will - Melee, 1 Target, Push - Dragon - Physical - DB6 - AC3 - The target is Pushed 6 meters minus their Weight Class. The target is also Tripped on 15+.

name: Shuckle's Berry Juice
effect: Heals 30 Hit Points. A Pokémon or Trainer can only consume one refreshment per half hour, unless they have the Gluttony Ability.

name: Premier Ball
effect: Given as promotional balls during sales.

name: Hazmat Suit
effect: Acts as a Gas Mask but also grants the Hazard Immunity capability and immunity to non-damaging Poison Type Moves. Body and Head equipment slots.

name: Combat Medic's Primer
effect: An invaluable guide to patient care, praised by rangers and others who need to administer first-aid on the job.\nRank 1 – Novice Medicine Education: After taking a Sprint Maneuver, you may apply a Restorative Item on an adjacent target as a Swift Action.\nRank 2 – Expert Medicine Education: Once per Scene as a Standard Action, you may target an adjacent ally. The target may immediately Take a Breather as a Full-Action Interrupt if they wish. They do not Shift and do not become Tripped as part of this action. If the target is Confused or Enraged, you must make a Medicine Education Check with a DC of 12 for them to be able to Take a Breather.

name: TM60 - Quash
effect: At-Will - 10, 1 Target, Social - Dark - Status - AC2 - Change the target's Initiative to 0 for the remainder of the round.

name: TM53 - Energy Ball
effect: EOT - 8, 1 Target - Grass - Special - DB9 - AC2 - Energy Ball lowers the foe’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Whipped Dream
effect: Evolves Swirlix.

name: Stealth Clothes
effect: Whether it’s a dark cloak and hood, a ninja suit, or spy gear, these clothes help you blend in. This body-slot equipment raises your modifier to Stealth Checks made to remain unseen by +4, to a maximum total modifier of +4.

name: Micle Berry
effect: Increases Accuracy by +1. Tier 2.

name: Root Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Wiki Berry
effect: Dry Treat. Heals 1/8th of the Pokémon’s Max HP. If the user likes the Treat’s flavor, it heals 1/6th instead. If the user dislikes the treat’s flavor, the user is Confused. Beauty Poffin Ingredient. Tier 2.

name: Type Brace (Normal)
effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Normal Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

effect: Lowers Special Attack stat by 1 if Trainer allows it.

effect: Grants the holder 15 Damage Reduction against all direct-damage Fighting Moves. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Fast Ball
effect: -20 Modifier if the target has a Movement Capability above 7.

effect: Grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct-damage Water Moves used by the holder. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: Pester Ball (Poison)

name: TM73 - Thunder Wave
effect: Scene x2 - 6, 1 Target - Electric - Status - AC4 - Thunder Wave cannot miss. Thunder Wave Paralyzes the target. Pokémon immune to Electric Attacks are immune to Thunder Wave's effect.

name: A Field Guide to Fungi
effect:
This book tells you which mushrooms are good to eat and which ones will give you a bad trip.

Rank 1 - Novice Survival: You automatically identify all Tiny Mushrooms, Big Mushrooms, and Balm Mushrooms you pick. Whenever you or your Pokémon consume one of those Mushrooms, they ignore the negative effect of the Mushroom (Hit Point loss, Poison, Combat Stage loss).
Rank 2 - Adept Survival: You can create the Hearty Meal Chef Recipe as an Extended Action but only by using Mushrooms as ingredients.

name: TM90 - Substitute
effect: Scene - Self, Illusion, Coat - Normal - Status - The user loses 1/4 of their maximum Hit Points. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented in any way. The user creates an Illusory Substitute Coat, which has Hit Points equal to 1/4th of the user’s full Hit Points +1. If the user would be hit by a Move or attack, instead the Substitute gets hit. Apply weakness, resistance and stats to the Substitute. The Substitute is immune to Status Afflictions and Status Moves. Moves with the Social or Sonic keywords completely ignore and bypass the Substitute. Once the Substitute has been destroyed, the user may be hit as normal. Substitute cannot be used if the user has less than 1/4 of their full Hit Points.

name: Magost Berry
effect: Cures Enraged condition. Tier 2.

name: TM77 - Psych Up
effect: Scene - 6, 1 Target - Normal - Status - The user's Combat Stages are changed to match the target's Combat Stages. Psych Up cannot miss.

name: Qualot Berry
effect: Lowers Defense Base Stat by 1 when consumed, only if Pokémon’s trainer wishes it to. Tier 3.

name: Mewtwonite X
effect: Mega Evolves Mewtwo when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Reinforced Trenchcoat
effect: A stylish utility version of Light Armor. Grants 5 Damage Reduction and provides a +4 bonus to Stealth checks to conceal weapons and prevents their detection by metal detectors.

name: Traditional Medicine Reference
effect:
A volume dedicated to properly preparing herbal medications. See PTU May 2015 Playtest Packet - Miscellaneous Errata for Herbal Restorative errata.

Rank 1 - Adept Medicine Education: Targets you administer Herbal Restoratives to do not lose Combat Stages no matter how many Herbal Restoratives they’ve had in the same day.
Rank 2 - Expert Medicine Education: Whenever you administer an Herbal Restorative to a target, they may choose to gain the Food Buff associated with Herbal Restoratives, regardless of how many Herbal Restoratives they’ve used this day.

name: Blastoisinite
effect: Mega Evolves Blastoise when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.

name: Gravity Modulation Suit
effect: You may treat the local gravity as if it were 1 lower or 1 higher. Changing the setting on the suit is an At-Will Extended Action requiring time for the suit to adjust to the new settings. Body equipment slot.

name: Type Plate (Ice)
effect: Acts as both a Type Booster (Ice) and a Type Brace (Ice). Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.

name: Maranga Berry
effect: +1 Special Defense Combat Stage. Activates as a Free Action when hit by a Special Move. Tier 3.

name: Study Manual
effect:
A Study Manual is always assigned to a single Skill and covers a specific narrow field that can be taken as a Skill Stunt.

Rank 1 - Novice General Education: You gain a Skill Stunt in the associated Skill of the Study Manual covering the narrow field specified by the Study Manual.
Rank 2 - Expert General Education: You gain a general +2 Bonus to the associated Skill. This Bonus does not stack with other bonuses from Books or Equipment to the same Skill.

name: Sunglasses
effect: +1 to Charm, Guile, and Intimidate Checks, to a maximum total modifier of +3.

name: Contest Fashion (Smart)
effect: Once per Contest the holder may re-roll any 1's made when using a Smart Move. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: How To Avoid Being Spooked
effect:
A questionable old tome filled with Ghost-related esoterica.

Rank 1 - Adept Occult Education: While holding a Cleanse Tag in your Main or Off-Hand Equipment Slot, you can see Pokémon and Trainers using the Invisibility Capability.
Rank 2 - Expert Occult Education: While holding a Cleanse Tag in your Main or Off-Hand Equipment Slot, you are immune to the Cursed Status Affliction.

name: Thunder Stone
effect: Evolves Pikachu, Eevee, Eelektrik

name: Basic Ball
effect: Basic Poké Ball; often called just a “Poké Ball”.

name: Contest Accessory
effect: The user rolls +2d6 during the Introduction Stage of a Contest. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Pheromone Emitter
effect: Emits pheromones as a Swift Action that give a +4 bonus to a Charm or Intimidate check against wild Pokémon. Requires a Pheromone Cartridge to use. Comes with 1 Cartridge. More can be bought for 250 apiece.

name: Extendable Grabby Arm
effect: Equipment Slot: Main Hand.\nA dexterous and flexible arm with a hand at the end. Can be used to grab and manipulate objects from 3 meters away.

name: Pink Pearl
effect: Acts as a Psychic Type Booster. If held by a Spoink, it also acts as a Special Attack Stat Booster.

name: Oxygenation Vial
effect: These vials contain a solution of oxygen-encasing lipids that are injected directly into the bloodstream. One injection is enough to allow the user to go without breathing for up to thirty minutes. Subsequent injections extend the effect, but each one after the first in a 24 hour period causes the user to take one injury as their body suffers complications from the imbalance caused by the solution. These are often carried as a last resort device for astronauts and deep sea divers, as well as used by EMTs to stabilize patients.

name: Heal Powder
effect: Cure all Persistent Status Afflictions – Herbal Restorative

name: TM28 - Leech Life
effect: Scene x2 - Melee, 1 Target - Bug - Physical - DB8 - AC2 - After the target takes damage, the user gains HP equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

These Books focus on one particular Pokemon Type.

Rank 2 - Expert Pokémon Education: When you apply Experience Training, you may choose to give one of your Pokémon of the studied Type +10 Bonus Experience. The same Pokémon cannot be chosen two days in a row.

name: Stat Booster (Accuracy)
effect: Grants the holder +1 Accuracy. Accessory Item for Trainers.

name: First Aid Manual
effect:
A training manual given to all EMTs.

Rank 1 - Novice Medicine Education: You gain a +10 Bonus to Medicine Education Checks made to use a First Aid Kit.
Rank 2 - Expert Medicine Education: You may use the First Aid Expertise Feature once per day.

effect: Evolves Spritzee.

Range: 6 Meters

» If the target is Medium Size or smaller, they are Slowed and Vulnerable

Rank 2 - Master Medicine Education: This effect can only be bound while taking an Extended Rest and Drains AP for the next day. During this Extended Rest, Pokémon and Trainers in your care heal twice as many Hit Points while resting, heal Injuries twice as quickly, and may heal an additional Injury per day. This stacks with use of Bandages.

Pokémon may still attack from the Hand Net using long-range attacks, or try to attack the net itself, potentially breaking it and freeing themselves. Capture Rolls against Pokémon in a net receive a -20 bonus.\n\nHand Nets with 50 Hit Points cost $100; 100 Hit Points cost $600; and 200 Hit Points cost $1500. Trainers using a Capture Styler may use Survival in place of Charm when raising the Disposition of Pokémon. \n\nAcquiring a Capture Styler is easy for those who become certified Pokémon Rangers; most qualified Rangers receive one as part of the job. They are not for sale to the general public, and it’s easy to assume that someone who has a Capture Styler is a Ranger.

name: Cap Cannon
effect: Capsule Cannons - or Cap Cannons for short - are two-handed pieces of Equipment which can be loaded with different types of Capsules (Caps) and fired. They can be fired as a Standard Action, and the range and effect of the Cannon depends on the Cap used. A Cap Cannon may have up to five Caps loaded in it at once, and they do not have to be fired in any particular order. You may load up to two Caps into a Cannon as a Standard Action. There are three types of Caps: Bean Caps, Glue Caps, and Net Caps. In addition to Caps, Capsule Cannons can also be loaded with Smoke Bombs, Pester Balls, and Poke Balls. When fired this way, these items behave normally but have a Range of 10 meters.

name: PP Up

Daily and Scene Moves gain an additional use in their Frequency’s unit of time. For example, a Daily Move becomes Daily x2, and a Scene x2 Move becomes Scene x3.

name: Lagging Item

name: Gengarite

name: Bait
effect:
Bait is a tasty, strong-smelling morsel of food designed to attract Pokémon. It may be used in two ways; to lure Pokémon, or to distract Pokémon.

To lure Pokémon, set the bait on a route. Every 15 minutes thereafter, roll 1d20 until you roll 15 or higher. If you roll 3 times without success, the bait loses its potency and fails. If you succeed however, a random Pokémon will appear. Bait is often used for Fishing in this way.
To distract Pokémon, throw it at a Wild Pokémon as a Standard Action. The target must then make a Focus Roll with a DC of 12. If they fail, the Pokémon gives up its next Standard Action to eat the food.

name: Yache Berry
effect: Grants a Food Buff which, when traded in, grants one step of resistance versus a foe's super effective Ice-type move. Tier 3.

name: Scrubbing Spray
effect: Sprays a chemical agent over an area that destroys most forensic evidence, such as trace biomatter. Perception checks to track someone or to search for forensic evidence take a -6 penalty. Requires a Scrub Cartridge to use. Comes with 1 Cartridge. Off Hand equipment slot.

name: Devil Case
effect: These dangerous and often illegal cases remove the failsafe on Poké Balls that prevents them from catching Pokémon that are at 0 Hit Points or less. effect: Snag Machines are extremely illegal machines that allow trainers to steal another Trainer’s Pokémon. They come in both large, immovable varieties and smaller portable varieties. The Portable Variety is an Accessory-Slot Item. Inserting a Poké Ball into a Large Snag Machine turns it into a Snag Ball permanently, but Large Snag Machines may only turn 5 Poké Balls into Snag Balls per day. Inserting a Poké Ball into a Portable Snag Machine, which is a Swift Action, turns it into a Snag Ball after one round, but only for that round. Snag Balls have the same properties as the Poké Ball type they were before being inserted into the machine, but receive a -2 penalty on all Poké Ball attack rolls, and are capable of capturing owned Pokémon. Snag Machines cannot be bought in stores, but may sell on the black market for prices of $30,000 or more.

name: Choice Item (Special Defense)
effect: The default state of the holder's Special Defense Stat is +2 Combat Stages. However, the holder is Suppressed and cannot be cured until the end of Combat, even if the item is removed. Cannot be used by Trainers.

name: Tough Poffin
effect: Raises Tough Contest Stat by +1 Contest Die.  Made with Aspear, Iapapa, Pinap, Durin, and Belue Berries.

name: Poké Ball Alarm
effect: A belt with six slots for Poké Balls. Poké Balls affixed to the belt are locked in place with a number pad password to unlock them. Tampering with the belt triggers the password prompt, and failure to input the correct password within a minute triggers a loud alarm system.

name: Plume Fossil
effect: A fossil of a Pokémon that lived in prehistoric times.

name: Utility Rope
effect: Braided Utility Rope. Has a tensile strength of 80 kg or 176 lbs. It has 20 Hit Points and 10 Damage Reduction.\n\nRope can only be damaged by Fire-Type attacks, attacks made with sharp objects(knives, swords, sharp teeth), and moves like Scratch, Slash, Leaf Blade, Razor Leaf, etc. The Move Cut ignores all Damage Reduction against Rope. Rope can be bought in any length of 25 ft up to 300.

name: Ice Stone
effect: Evolves Eevee, Alolan Sandshrew, Alolan Vulpix.

name: Prism Scale
effect: Evolves Feebas.
